description:
The story revolves around Haruka Nanase, a boy who has always loved to be immersed in water, and to swim in it. Before graduating from elementary school, he participated in a swimming tournament along with his fellow swimming club members, Makoto Tachibana, Nagisa Hazuki, and Rin Matsuoka. After achieving victory, each of the boys went their separate ways.

Time passed, and in the middle of their uneventful high school lives Rin appears and challenges Haruka to a match, showing Haruka his overwhelming power. Not wanting it to end like this, Haruka, gathers together Makoto and Nagisa once again and brings a new member named Rei Ryugazaki to create the Iwatobi High School Swimming Club in order to defeat Rin.

(Source: Anime News Network)

node.description:
__Height:__ 182 cm (6'0")

[Website](https://miyanomamoru.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyanomamoru_pr) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHzevlEL9JfsBIm86uNCJqg)

A Japanese actor, voice actor, singer and narrator from Saitama Prefecture.

Miyano joined The Himawari Theatre Group at the age of 7 under the influence of his older brother, yet he did not attend the class as much as he should have. After entering high school, due to the uncertainty he felt towards the future, Miyano started attending singing and dance lessons he has been skipping until now. While taking music lessons, Miyano started to discover his music style through the encounter with music produced by singers like CHEMISTRY and EXILE. Miyano's first acting job was in 1992 in Tokusou Exceedraft, where he appeared in a flashback as a child in a yakuza member's past.

In 2001, he had his voice acting debut in a live action teen drama Caitlin's Way.

In 2002, he voiced Riku in the Japanese version for the video game Kingdom Hearts. Miyano also had his first anime voice acting role the same year, voicing Akira in [Shin Megami Tensei Devil Children: Light & Dark](https://anilist.co/anime/4068/). In 2003, he voiced [Kiba](https://anilist.co/character/241/), the main character in [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/). A few years later in 2006, he had what most would call his breakout role in [Death Note](https://anilist.co/anime/1535/) where he voiced the main character [Light Yagami](https://anilist.co/character/80/). For his role as Light, he was nominated for two awards at the first ever Seiyuu Awards in March 2007.

On May 28, 2007, on the King Records label, Miyano debuted as a singer with the single "Kuon." The single debuted at number 47 on the Oricon charts and was used as the ending theme song for anime series [Koutetsu Sangokushi](https://anilist.co/anime/2162/). On June 13, he released a collaboration single titled "Fight," with fellow voice actress [Romi Park](https://anilist.co/staff/95082/). The duo's single debuted on the Oricon chart at number 73.

In 2008, at the second Seiyuu Awards, Miyano won "Best Actor in a Leading Role" for his roles [Setsuna F. Seiei](https://anilist.co/character/4234/) and [Rikuson Hakugen](https://anilist.co/character/2844/), from [Mobile Suit Gundam 00](https://anilist.co/anime/2581/) and [Koutetsu Sangokushi](https://anilist.co/anime/2162/) respectively. Miyano also married later that same year and he and his wife have a son together.

__Non-anime voice roles:__
- Riku - *Kingdom Hearts* series (VG)
- Ignis Scientia - *Final Fantasy XV* (2016 VG)
- Peter B. Parker - *Spider-Man: Into The Spider Verse; Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse* (Films; JP dub)
- Mario - *The Super Mario Bros. Movie* (2023 Film; JP dub)
- Newt Scamander - *Fantastic Beasts* series (Live action films; JP dub)
- Percy Weasley - *Harry Potter* franchise (Live action films; JP dub)

__Height:__ 167cm 
__Hobbies:__ Snowboarding  

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/DH_official__)

**Non-Anime Roles**:

[Profile](http://www.kenproduction.co.jp/talent/member.php?mem=m47) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/numanumakapa)

Married voice actress [Yuka Nishigaki](https://anilist.co/staff/105045) in 2015. Part of the trio Trignal with fellow voice actors [Takuya Eguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/102695/Takuya-Eguchi) and [Ryohei Kimura](https://anilist.co/staff/96762). Hosts radio programs for Kiramune.

__Non-Anime Roles:__

Jude Mathis in "Tales of the Heroes: Twin Brave" (VG) (Japanese)
Jude Mathis in "Tales of the World: Reve Unitia" (VG) (Japanese)
Jude Mathis in "Tales of Xillia 2" (VG) (Japanese)
Jude Mathis in "Tales of Xillia" (VG) (Japanese)
Kashiwagi Yuu in "Kirai ja nai Kedo" (Drama CD) (Japanese)
Kashiwagi Yuu in "Warui Koto Shitai" (Drama CD) (Japanese)
Kenshin Kagemitsu in "Touken Ranbu" (VG) (Japanese)
Kurumi in "Side Kicks!" (VG) (Japanese)
Main Character in "Toki to Eien ~Toki Towa~" (VG) (Japanese)
Mias in "Moujuutachi to Ohime-sama ~in blossom~" (VG) (Japanese)
Mias in "Moujuutachi to Ohime-sama" (VG) (Japanese)
Momota Itsuki in "Mispri! Miss Princess" (VG) (Japanese)
Rengokuin in "Rust Blaster" (Drama CD) (Japanese)
Shinji Naruse in "LUX-PAIN" (VG) (Japanese)
Shunya in "Blazer Drive" (Japanese)
Tokio Horou / Ethan Kairos in "Time Hollow" (VG) (Japanese)
Vermeil in "Granblue Fantasy" (VG) (Japanese)
Wataru Kagurazaka in "Gakuen Club" (VN) (Japanese)
Yukihiko Himeno in "CV: Casting Voice" (VG) (Japanese)
Yumiru in "Avalon Code" (VG) (Japanese)!~

__Height:__ 173 cm

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ta2hisa_suzuki) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ta2hisa_suzuki/)

Tatsuhisa is a Japanese voice actor and singer, and he is affiliated with I'm Enterprise and Lantis. He is the vocalist of the rock band [OLDCODEX](https://anilist.co/staff/112151/OLDCODEX) under his stage name Ta_2, who also provides the opening/ending themes of many of the anime he stars in. He not only sings but also composes some of the songs. He also belongs to Style Five, in charge of the endings of Free! He also likes bicycling, karaoke, reading and video games. 

He is known for his numerous roles in anime series, his main breakout roles in the West were as Takao in Kuroko no Basuke and especially as Makoto Tachibana in Free!. He is not only known for his voice in anime, but also in video games. For example, he gave voice to Noctis (FFXV) and Alfonse (FEH). 

He is married to the famous singer [LiSA](https://anilist.co/staff/105561/LiSA). In late July 2021, it was reported that he was involved in an affair with a 20-year old fan. The next month he announced that he would suspend all entertainment activities due to poor health, later issuing an apology for his "irresponsible and inappropriate actions". His agency stated that he would gradually resume activities while recovering. In March 2022, his agency announced his full return to work from hiatus, along with another apology to fans.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

Futoshi Nishiya was a character designer and animator affiliated with Kyoto Animation.

He tragically lost his life alongside 34 colleagues in the Kyoto Animation arson attack on July 18, 2019.

Affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/) since 1989.

Worked as an animator in the beginning of his career.

**Height:** 174 cm  

[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/nobunagashimazaki/) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/nobunaga_s) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nobunaga_s/)

Non-Anime Roles:
~!Kaedehara Kazuha - Genshin Impact (Video Game)
Silver - Twisted Wonderland (Video Game)!~

__Graduated:__ Tokyo College of Music

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cut_tatsu7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tatsuya__kato/)

OLDCODEX was a Japanese rock band from Tokyo, Japan, formed in 2009.

On August 4, 2021, Ta_2 announced he was going on hiatus, with Oldcodex subsequently pausing their activities as well. On December 27, 2021, it was announced that Oldcodex was set to disband following the release of the theme song for the upcoming Free! movie on the original soundtrack album which is scheduled for April 2022. They officially disbanded on May 31, 2022.

__Members:__ 
 - Vocal: Ta_2 ([Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735))
 - Painter, Lyrics: YORKE
 - Drums: Ryo Yamagata
 - Bass Guitar: Taizo Nakamura
 - Guitar: Shinji Oomura


In February 15, 2010, YoHsKE and sae left the band. 
In November 1, 2010, YORKE. who is responsible for the artworks became an official member.  
In October 15, 2012, [R・O・N](https://anilist.co/staff/106037/Ryuuta-Iida) left the band.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/saifu1low)

Masahiro Yokotani does series composition and scriptwriting.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/saifu1low)

Masahiro Yokotani does series composition and scriptwriting.

Hiroko Utsumi is a Japanese director and animator.

Utsumi is best known for her work with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/), particularly as the original director of [Free!](https://anilist.co/anime/18507/), and for her later work at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/), where she directed [Banana Fish](https://anilist.co/anime/100388/). She is a graduate of the Osaka Municipal College of Design.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/saifu1low)

Masahiro Yokotani does series composition and scriptwriting.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/3232480742) | [Tumblr](https://gagawa62.tumblr.com/) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/gawasan864)

Originating from [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B1%B1%E7%94%B0%E5%B0%9A%E5%AD%90) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naoko_Yamada)

Naoko Yamada is a Japanese animator and director. She worked at [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/) from 2004 to 2020. 

Yamada enjoyed drawing as a child and would copy images from the [Patlabor](https://anilist.co/anime/324/) and [Dragon Ball](https://anilist.co/anime/223/) series. She joined the volleyball club in primary school and the tennis and photography clubs in high school. At the Kyoto University of Art and Design, she studied oil painting and was a member of the special effects club. She intended to work in film after university, but instead decided to join Kyoto Animation after seeing an advertisement. Her first assignment at the studio was drawing in between frames for [Inuyasha](https://anilist.co/anime/249/), which Kyoto Animation helped produce. She was eventually promoted to a key animator for [Air](https://anilist.co/anime/101/).

After working as an episode director of [Clannad](https://anilist.co/anime/2167/), she was asked to make her chief directorial debut with [K-ON!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680/), an adaptation of a slice-of-life manga. The series was very successful, spurring a second season and a film. In 2013, she directed [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417/), and followed it with the film [Tamako Love Story](https://anilist.co/anime/20519/) in 2014. For Tamako Love Story, she was awarded the New Face Award at the Japan Media Arts Festival. She storyboarded the entire film herself, and also wrote the lyrics for the opening theme song, “Everybody Loves Somebody.”

Yamada's next project was the feature film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954/), an adaptation of [Yoshitoki Ooima](https://anilist.co/staff/105951/)’s manga by the same name. The film reflected on elements of bullying and physical impairment in Japan. The film opened at #2 in the Japanese Box Office and grossed a total of ¥2.3 billion (~$21.7m USD), the 19th highest-grossing film in Japan in 2016. The film also received multiple award nominations, including Best Animation Film in the Mainichi Film Awards and the Excellent Animation of the Year in the Japan Academy Prize.

For Yamada, the most important part of being a director is to observe people. She describes herself as a "method" director, emphasizing the minds of the characters.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B1%B1%E7%94%B0%E5%B0%9A%E5%AD%90) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Naoko_Yamada)

[Official Website](https://www.rieke-werner.de/) | [Synchronkartei](https://www.synchronkartei.de/sprecher/3279/2) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/strawbellycake/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/rieke_werner) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/riekewerner) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCXcDQvUYX1oCtx53ueUAaEQ)

Rieke Werner, also known under the pseudonym StrawbellyCake, is a German voice actress and singer.

[Instagram 1](https://www.instagram.com/renanvidaldub/) | [Instagram 2](https://www.instagram.com/versaobrazueira/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RenanVidalDub) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/renanvidaldub) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@versaobrazueira) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/RenanNest)

Renan Vidal is a Brazilian actor, voice actor and dubbing director.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Credence Barebone (Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them trilogy)
- Radicles X "Rad" (OK K.O.! Let's Be Heroes)
- Malcolm Stone (Never Have I Ever)
- Overflow (Ben 10 2016)
- Duncan P. Anderson (Monsters at Work)
- Ricardo "Ricky" Flores (O11CE)
- David Rose (2nd voice; Schitt's Creek)
- Joshua "Josh" Rosza (The Originals)
- Sky (2nd voice - 8th season; Winx Club)
- 'Mac' MacBentley (Zero Chill)
!~
